original_solution_mapping.L1: Marta had 1000 kg of tomatoes on Friday and sold 300 kg on Saturday, so she has 1000 - 300 = <<1000-300=700>>700 kg of tomatoes left.
original_solution_mapping.L2: On Sunday 200 kg of tomatoes had to be thrown away, so 700 - 200 = <<700-200=500>>500 kg of tomatoes were left.
original_solution_mapping.L3: The shipment on Monday was twice the size of the first one, so it was 2 * 1000 = <<2*1000=2000>>2000 kg of tomatoes.
original_solution_mapping.L4: The total amount of tomatoes ready for sale on Tuesday was 500 + 2000 = <<500+2000=2500>>2500 kg.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3106.
    Returns: the total kilograms of tomatoes Marta had ready for sale on Tuesday.
    """
    # L1
    initial_shipment_friday = 1000 # shipment of 1000 kg of tomatoes arrived
    sold_saturday = 300 # sold a total of 300 kg of tomatoes
    remaining_after_saturday_sale = initial_shipment_friday - sold_saturday

    # L2
    rotted_sunday = 200 # 200 kg of tomatoes to rot
    remaining_after_sunday_rot = remaining_after_saturday_sale - rotted_sunday

    # L3
    multiplier_monday_shipment = 2 # twice the size of the first one
    monday_shipment_size = multiplier_monday_shipment * initial_shipment_friday

    # L4
    total_for_tuesday = remaining_after_sunday_rot + monday_shipment_size

    # FA
    answer = total_for_tuesday
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Marta had {initial_shipment_friday} kg of tomatoes on Friday and sold {sold_saturday} kg on Saturday, so she has {initial_shipment_friday} - {sold_saturday} = <<{initial_shipment_friday}-{sold_saturday}={remaining_after_saturday_sale}>>{remaining_after_saturday_sale} kg of tomatoes left.

On Sunday {rotted_sunday} kg of tomatoes had to be thrown away, so {remaining_after_saturday_sale} - {rotted_sunday} = <<{remaining_after_saturday_sale}-{rotted_sunday}={remaining_after_sunday_rot}>>{remaining_after_sunday_rot} kg of tomatoes were left.

The shipment on Monday was twice the size of the first one, so it was {multiplier_monday_shipment} * {initial_shipment_friday} = <<{multiplier_monday_shipment}*{initial_shipment_friday}={monday_shipment_size}>>{monday_shipment_size} kg of tomatoes.

The total amount of tomatoes ready for sale on Tuesday was {remaining_after_sunday_rot} + {monday_shipment_size} = <<{remaining_after_sunday_rot}+{monday_shipment_size}={total_for_tuesday}>>{total_for_tuesday} kg.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: On Sunday 200 kg of tomatoes had to be thrown away, so 700 - 200 = <<700-200=500>>500 kg of tomatoes were left.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The shipment on Monday was twice the size of the first one, so it was 2 * 200 = <<2*200=400>>400 kg of tomatoes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: The total amount of tomatoes ready for sale on Tuesday was 500 + 400 = <<500+400=900>>900 kg.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'rotted_sunday' (200) was used instead of 'initial_shipment_friday' (1000).
